location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 6: Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, Writing from the Honourable Company's Sloop Clive, Near Bassadore [Bāsa‘īdū], to Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter, Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, writing from near Bassadore [Bāsa‘īdū], relays intelligence from Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh]. The intelligence mainly concerns Muktoom ben Buttee [Shaikh Maktoum bin Buti], Chief of Debaye [Dubai], who reportedly visited Sohar [Ṣuḥār] for half a day before proceeding to Muscat.
